problem.p: Which of the following are examples of PARTIALLY Correct Algorithms?

checkboxgroup.choice: An algorithm that reports the winning moves for a tic tac toe game.
An algorithm that reports the sum of a finite list of numbers.
An algorithm that reports the winning moves to win a pacman game.

div.p: The algorithms 1 and 3 will only report the winning move if there is a winning move in each state of the game. Therefore, they are 'partially correct', because they sometimes report, but when they do, what they report is correct. The second choice will report the correct answer everytime, for any list of numbers.
